page.title: 01DROITWICH_Site & Gazetteer
page.content: Droitwich is a small town to the north east of Worcester.It is a busy shopping centre with an expanding industrial estate and developing residential areas.The town is surrounded by good quality agricultural land which supports a variety of farming types. The town is built over keuper marl and other sedimentary rocks. The population of the town has grown steadily to its present figure of 20,634 (May 1985). Its everyday affairs are run by the town council which is elected by the residents of Droitwich. It is linked with other centres by motorways,road networks and railways. The town is expected to grow steadily in the near future as housing estates continue to be developed to the south and east of the town.
